intro: Asteroschoenus, commonly known as the star-sedge, is a genus of aquatic and semi-aquatic plants belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, including marshes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. Its rhizomes help it spread and establish dense colonies in moist soils. Asteroschoenus plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems by preventing erosion and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
